    • Maximum slides per week

    Maximum slides per week

    maxslidesweek.Rmd

    In which Week happended the most slides

    • Use the iffi-data to find out in which week the most events happened

    • We use the data that already comes with the iffitoR-package

    • first we load the packages

    library(iffitoR)
library(lubridate)
library(stringr)
library(leaflet.extras)
library(sf)
library(leaflet)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(glue)
library(forcats)
    • now we load the iffi-data (it is actually already loaded)
    data_iffi = landsld
glimpse(data_iffi)
#> Rows: 10,482
#> Columns: 18
#> $ PIFF_ID       <dbl> 20100, 30100, 30200, 30300, 30400, 30500, 30600, 40100, ~
#> $ area          <int> 272156, 0, 0, 83566, 0, 0, 0, NA, 57402, 0, 0, 0, 0, 463~
#> $ first_level   <chr> "complex", "area subject to rockfall/topple", "fall-type~
#> $ material      <chr> "rock", "rock", "rock", "rock", "rock", "rock", "rock", ~
#> $ second_level  <chr> "n.d.", "n.d.", "fall-type", "fall-type", "fall-type", "~

    • the data that comes with the package is already pre-processed. Meaning it has the classification-columns in english and some computed day-columns

    Max Slides per Day

    • We yet dont have the data agggregated per week, so lets have a look which day was the day with the most slides
    data_iffi %>% 
  filter(str_detect(second_level, "translational")) %>% 
  count(date, sort=T)
#> Simple feature collection with 181 features and 2 fields
#> geometry type:  GEOMETRY
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: 610817.1 ymin: 5122702 xmax: 757506.2 ymax: 5219081
#> projected CRS:  WGS 84 / UTM zone 32N
#> First 10 features:
#>          date   n                       geometry
#> 1        <NA> 668 MULTIPOINT ((610817.1 51668...
#> 2  2020-12-06  13 MULTIPOINT ((644648.9 51669...
#> 3  2007-06-21   9 MULTIPOINT ((677353.1 51966...
#> 4  2002-11-26   6 MULTIPOINT ((658514.2 51685...
#> 5  2000-11-18   5 MULTIPOINT ((619146.7 51660...
#> 6  2020-08-30   5 MULTIPOINT ((665473.7 51616...
#> 7  1998-10-07   4 MULTIPOINT ((665008.8 51886...
#> 8  2002-11-16   4 MULTIPOINT ((652515.5 51701...
#> 9  2019-11-17   4 MULTIPOINT ((667328.2 51678...
#> 10 1997-06-26   3 MULTIPOINT ((694473.2 51574...
    • The 6th of Decemeber in 2020 was the day with the most translational Landslides (13) in the iffi-recording on one day.

    Visualize the max slides per day

    dat = data_iffi %>% 
  filter(date == as.Date("2020-12-06")) %>% 
  st_transform(4326)


# the color palette for the categorical data 
cf = colorFactor(palette = "RdYlBu", domain=dat$second_level)
sl = unique(dat$second_level)

map = leaflet(dat) %>%
  addProviderTiles(providers$Stamen.TonerLite) 

for (g in sl) {
  d = dat %>% filter(second_level == g)
  map = map %>% addCircles(
    data = d,
    popup = paste0("date: ", d$date, "<br>", "type:", d$second_level),
    color =  ~ cf(d$second_level),
    group = g
  )
}

map %>% addLayersControl(overlayGroups = sl)
